intro: Pagamea conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pagamea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), providing a drought-resistant feature. Pagamea conferta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
